problem.markdown:
>>Increasing the capacity of a single queue, single server from 1 \(\mu\) to 2 \(\mu\) (check all that apply): <<
[x] Increases the maximum allowable customer arrival rate that is allowed for a steady-state solution to exist. [ ] Decreases the waiting time when the arrival rate is between 1 \(\mu\) and 2 \(\mu\). [x] Decreases the waiting time for all arrival rates.
[explanation] Doubling the capacity also doubles the maximum customer arrival rate for a system. Because the single server has a higher capacity, it is able to process clients faster, regardless of whether the arrival rate is low or high. [explanation]
